website_summaries.verdict: Very inexpensive charcoal chimney starter that works better with small grills than large ones.
pros: Simple design that lights charcoal effectively
Thin metal means the chimney starter doesn't weigh much and is easy to move into place
May not light the charcoal as fast as some other units, but it will get the job done over time
One of the least costly chimneys you'll find
cons: Only holds a small amount of charcoal adequately
Metal can be sharp to the touch

customer_reviews.title: works ok better than starter fluid
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this to using starter fluid. Only charcoal taste no hydrocarbon smell or taste. This works well. I gave it a 4* because in comparison to the previous one I owned (had to replace because I ran over it with my car in the garage), this seems to have a smaller capacity and just isn't quite as good. still it works well enough and the price was good; and I'm not going back to lighter fluid. also you can add more charcoal aroung the base before you light it or after you poor the coals before puttimg the grill over it.*** caution: use an oven mit, the handle gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: slimpc

customer_reviews.title: Griller's friend
customer_reviews.text: This was actually bigger than we expected. I don't know why we didn't think it would be the size that it is, but it's nice. Definitely worth the money. We always struggle with charcoal when grilling out, it usually takes us a few tries before they catch. But with this, it works well! Glad we decided to go for it. We usually use gas, so this helps a lot when we use the charcoal side.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: Skip it. Get a better model.
customer_reviews.text: Skip this. It’s not worth the modest savings over better models. The constitution is not robust, the grate holes on the bottom are too large, the handle is cheap and cheezy. Not exactly a complete waste of money, but not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy from France in the corner

customer_reviews.title: Charcoal chimney working great
customer_reviews.text: I had always used lighter fluid and never really tasted it in my cooking, but I bought a new grill and read that lighter fluid can possibly cause paint to peel and lead to rust. I gave this chimney a try and have enjoyed using it. I rip up pieces of the charcoal bag and burn it to start the chimney since I don't get a newspaper. It seems well made and has held up for several cooks now.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Easy BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I used to think people that used these to start coals were losers. Now that I use this I think I people not using them are losers. This product makes starting coals quicker and more efficient. This product starts coals easily without breaking the bank. This is also a useful tool for starting fires when conditions aren't the best.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Good budget chimney starter
customer_reviews.text: Was in need of an extra chimney starter as I misplaced my good one on a trip. This was available next day in a pinch so I gave it a shot. Good all-around construction. It's a little flimsy and I wish it was a little easier to get under to light. But I've been using it regularly for a few months now and I'd buy it again if I was in need.
customer_reviews.author: Surviving The Burbs

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I dont normally write reviews but feel implied to for this purchase. We previously had a charbroil brand chimney which worked great for years. I replaced it with this one and am disappointed. It does not hold much paper for lighting m, so it takes multiple attempts at getting the charcoal lit. It's a pain and not worth the money!!! Buy a name brand chimney!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Toss out your lighter fluid
customer_reviews.text: My fiancée is the cook, and this has made her grilling experience SO MUCH BETTER! Trying to get charcoal to light was a pain, wasn’t thrilled on using lighter fluid and could sometimes taste the lighter fluid on our food. This chimney has changed the game. No longer need to use any lighter fluid and charcoal starts smoking very quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael M Ersland

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: I actually use this as a small incinerator for mail items I can't easily shred. I put the items in this (packed loosely to allow for air circulation), add a few drops of a fire starter, and then light them. An hour later I have safely and securely destroyed identification sensitive items.
customer_reviews.author: sisyphus99

customer_reviews.title: An old dog can learn a new trick.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Crumple up some newspaper, stick it in the bottom, set it on a safe surface such as concrete, or better yet, a grill grate, light the paper in the bottom, and away she goes! 15 minutes later, coals are ashed over and you're ready to cook. Great heat shield and sturdy handle that stays relatively cool. Goodbye lighter fluid!
customer_reviews.author: musicman

customer_reviews.title: Same as in store but for less $$
customer_reviews.text: It’s the same as what you would buy in the store, but for a better price. No complaints on quality. These things are subject to a lot of abuse and hold up well considering. I expect about 2 years of use from this.
customer_reviews.author: N.K.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The product works, but not as well as my former chimney starter. My old starter had holes up the sides of the starter which I think helped provide more air to speed lighting the charcoal. This one works but is slower in getting the fire going.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Prindle

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Chimney didn't last long and is made cheaply. Pay a little extra and get the Weber instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Quick & Easy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this Charcoal starter years ago. So Simple & easy & a time saver. Now I grill more often.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kohlhepp

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to do!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to do. The only issue is that you must have good air flow to the bottom of the chimney I only use newspaper which means sometimes you have to elevate it in order to make sure the paper burns enough for the coals to get started. This may not be an issue if you use another starter. Once it gets going it doesn't take long for the coals to ash over. The handle is a good length that allows you to handle it well without getting burned.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Lee

customer_reviews.title: Big
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of charcoal so would be nice if you could pull a pin and the bottom would drop down to eliminate having to dump with sparks flying in your face.
customer_reviews.author: JMA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a small one since it's just the 2 of us. Have a big one if we need it but this one is perfect and one used 99.9% of the time!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Westra

customer_reviews.title: Turned my charcoal into a burning tower of fire in no time.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the charcoal heats up much more efficiently than with lighter fluid. Got started faster and hotter, and cooked quicker and more evenly. And it's made in the USA - I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: LuLu

customer_reviews.title: The only way to start coals
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only issue is that the handle was hot once the coals were ready. I would by one with a wood handle instead of a plastic one like this one.
customer_reviews.author: C.G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for staring your briquets
customer_reviews.text: I use this in conjunction with a wad of paper and some lighter fluid. One match is all it takes to get a fire going, and within 15-20 minutes my coals are ready to dump into the grill. I deducted one star because after only two uses, the metal has discolored.
customer_reviews.author: orion1113

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I use a smoker so when my temp is starting to fall I fire up the chimney with out open my fire box. When the chimney is ready open the fire box and pour in the charcoal. This way I don’t have the white smoke off the charcoal on my meats.
customer_reviews.author: Shane  Hembrough

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to use charcoal, get this. Makes life much easier. Add wadded up news paper in the bottom, several, then coals on top. Light from the bottom and wait until all your coals/bricketts are going, and you have a great base to go from. No fluid needed.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: this chimney does the job. i start the charcoal with weber fire cubes and within 15-20 mins am ready to cook. i will never again go back to lighter fluid. it holds about 4lbs of briquettes and lights them quickly. highly recommend this chimney
customer_reviews.author: RANDY L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked!! Need next size up!!!
customer_reviews.text: Where this have been why am I just finding out abt this product can't wait to oder a second one I have a pretty good size grill so I have use it twice back to back it a life saver and save money on lighter fluid thanks a again million times over
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Great Charcoal Starter
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these because I've hated to have to start charcoal grills. It worked 'as advertised' and I am very happy to be able to use charcoal again.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, started fire fast.
customer_reviews.text: vent design makes started fire quick and easy, but the material is thin and a little shaky while you hold it. Overall it is a OK tools to help you started fire!
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS.Y

customer_reviews.title: rusted after awhile but still works
customer_reviews.text: this thing is galvanized. zinc melts at a very low temperature.... the rust protection won't last very long so keep this out of the rain once the zinc is gone
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: and they work better than my last ones
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for these things but didn't know what they were called, so when I found these, I bought 2, and they work better than my last ones! They were delivered before I finished marinating! Great stuff, will send folks your way!
customer_reviews.author: Stiffroot

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Larger than expected, but glad it is. Sturdily built, easy to use, and no fluid involved.
customer_reviews.author: Phx BJ

customer_reviews.title: Simple, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Simple and inexpensive. Using paper to start coals does not impart off flavors from lighter fluid.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Just can't beat the value. Throw out the lighter fluid! Works as advertised, or better!
customer_reviews.author: george s masich

customer_reviews.title: Mine has lasted 3 years so far, in good shape still
customer_reviews.text: This is a godsend, no self respecting amateur bar b que'r should be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Wurlatrble

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I can't stand lighter fluid
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I can't stand lighter fluid, and the little peat bricks take long and create too many uneven heat patches. This is awesome at starting with a couple of pages from the daily newspaper and a lighter.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: its big
customer_reviews.text: Its big, US made and seems to be a quality product. Competitively priced. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Barrington

customer_reviews.title: A Great Price for a Reliable Product
customer_reviews.text: This charcoal starter works great. It is easy to use and a great price. I HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Minor

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got this when my old one disappeared. Works good. Good sized. Hope it lasts through next season. Used it all summer so far and had great charcoal results.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but functional
customer_reviews.text: It’s made poorly but it does what it’s supposed to do. I had one like it 10 years ago and it was way better quality. Update: After 4 uses the handle caught fire and I made to make modification in order to use further.
customer_reviews.author: Spoonman

customer_reviews.title: Very safe and work well and fast
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I love it. I get my charcoal ready in less than 10 minutes. Safe and and very well designed and built. very sure and you don't burn when you grab it
customer_reviews.author: Idania

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Ahhhh, easy and worry free charcoal starter. What a great invention.
customer_reviews.author: Dianep

customer_reviews.title: Great chimney!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size at a great price. It heats the charcoal quickly without the use of chemicals. I love itb
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Butts

customer_reviews.title: Works great and good airflow
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as my brand name ones at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: Works great getting the (lump) charcoal lit
customer_reviews.text: Works great getting the (lump) charcoal lit, no fanning, relighting or lighter fluid. Using less charcoal to get the same amount of work done too. Wish I had 4 or 5 of these for when I used to do catering.
customer_reviews.author: ScrubbaDub

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only takes around 10-15 mins to get the Charcoal nice and hot
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Massey

customer_reviews.title: Great chimney.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this price for what you get. This chimney does EXACTLY what I want it to. I’ve had issues with multiple bottom release chimney starters due to the mechanism failing. I was ready to make the change to this style and I am thrilled that I did!!!
customer_reviews.author: alind503

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: A must buy . A little bit of lighter on the paper and BOOM , leave it alone for 30 min and the charcoal will be ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: RIC

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This works great. A few sheets of paper in bottom and lights charcoal nicely. No fluid.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I don't expect this chimney to last more than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like this way of starting the charcoal. It does not have that lighter fluid taste. Starts easy. Then just spread them in the grill. Cool!
customer_reviews.author: janet mcgahey

customer_reviews.title: Great starter with an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: This starter works perfectly. It holds quite a few briquettes and is easy to use when putting hot coals into the barbeque.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R.

customer_reviews.title: Looked good out of the box. I’ll replace the handle with a wood one like my last one.
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it to start charcoal in my kamado grill the plastic handle melted. Not impressed, i am an engineer and I think I could design something better. The price of $4.99 sounded good though,
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Great product and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Works great,wish I had tried one of these YEARS ago !
customer_reviews.author: Dragonass

customer_reviews.title: No more starter fluid for me!!! Lights ...
customer_reviews.text: No more starter fluid for me!!! Lights everytime and gets the coals red hot if I want to leave them in longer. This is a no brainer if you grill using charcoal
customer_reviews.author: MilesTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Chimney Starter Cheaply Made.
customer_reviews.text: The chimney starter was forming rust on the side after the first use. Would not recommend buying it over the name brand. Cheap and not well made. They have two products to make it look like this is half-way decent.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Samet

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, durable.
customer_reviews.text: Durable, I've used it several times already this past month. I seen other charcoal starters at a higher price. But this one gets the job done and cheaper. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: the chimney works well and gets the job done :)
customer_reviews.author: Juan Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works well but coating melts.
customer_reviews.text: The galvanized metal doesn't stay galvanized past 600 degrees apparently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer

customer_reviews.title: quick start
customer_reviews.text: better than using fuel on coals your going to eat on
customer_reviews.author: larry byers

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with this chimney’s performance for a great price, no complaints!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard H Burgin Jr

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not at all built to last, I'll stick to my primo starter
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: the perfect starter! replaced my 35 yr old one
customer_reviews.text: Ah, the perfect starter! replaced my 35 yr old one... works great. Shipped as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Kath-a-lou

customer_reviews.title: Thin metal, low price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for with this, as the metal is much thinner that my other Weber one. Keeping it, but don't expect it to last long.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Hiller

customer_reviews.title: A pillar of fire.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've used one of these and it was AMAZING.
customer_reviews.author: nancy b.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Has worked as designed and no issues for the past few months.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G

customer_reviews.title: extra help is here
customer_reviews.text: I use torch to start fire and this i handy to do that
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be built well. I have used it twice with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lani

customer_reviews.title: Best price I've seen in years
customer_reviews.text: My second one in 6 years, and I use it ALOT. Best price I've seen in years.
customer_reviews.author: jjoplin

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for my husband and he loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband and he loves it. Now I need another one for my new grill. I definitely prefer this method over lighter fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Price is good.
customer_reviews.text: It works, and replaces our rusted out one. Price is good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shenton

customer_reviews.title: Huge charcoal starter for a small price
customer_reviews.text: this is a large container and is less expensive as some of the smaller ones I have seen - Great deal for a low price
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: It lasts 2-3 years. Galvanized steel rusts quick
customer_reviews.text: Great cheap way to start fires, just takes 1 full sheet of newspaper
customer_reviews.author: Charles Michael

customer_reviews.title: Super easy as well
customer_reviews.text: Works really well in our heavy winds (even in winter) here in Wyoming. Super easy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Shiverdecker

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly and is as described good alternative to using chemicals to start BBQ
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor rivets
customer_reviews.text: Lower rivet was not fully secured through the chimney. Not usable in the current condition. :(
customer_reviews.author: Michelle R.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Spend the extra couple bucks and get the one with the extra holes all around the chimney he comes in handy had to drill holes on mine in order to get the airflow to all the charcoal
customer_reviews.author: Jose Felix

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Saves a lot of money on buying charcoal starting fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hunnicutt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I am the charcoal starter and my husband does the rest. For me it was easy to use and had a lot of room than the one we had before.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great. So much easier and faster than lighter fluid...plus..no lighter fluid.
customer_reviews.author: kjinmo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a few bbq, faster way to start coals.
customer_reviews.author: Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Really easy to use and I saved time.
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Handle support popped out within a few months of usage ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle support popped out within a few months of usage. Not broken, and you can put it back in, but definitely not 'high' quality.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. Does exactly what you expected to do
customer_reviews.author: Mery Mason

customer_reviews.title: Grill ready in just 3 easy steps!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and made fire. What more could you ask?
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Right price for temporary Starter
customer_reviews.text: Very thin metal construction. Probably won't last a grilling season, but right price
customer_reviews.author: Michael quinn

customer_reviews.title: Great for a smaller pit
customer_reviews.text: Holds a small amount of coals, I had to burn 4 batches to fill a medium Old Smokey. Great for a smaller pit, GiGi
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small
customer_reviews.text: Works fine but not a very good chimney for larger grills. I'd estimate it to only hold about 25 bricks of coal.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Does the job perfectly well. I recommend it. Value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Gagan rastogi

customer_reviews.title: I have used Weber starter chimneys for years and love them. This one is poorly designed
customer_reviews.text: I have used Weber starter chimneys for years and love them. This one is poorly designed. It holds insufficient newspaper and seems to lack proper ventilation. The result is unreliable starting of the charcoal fire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will last enough to be a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, not a lifetime product. Will last enough to be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: M Allister

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband. He uses it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Brandi S

customer_reviews.title: The handle in the picture is not what i got ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle in the picture is not what i got delivered, i thought you get what you pay for or a picture you see is what you pay for????
customer_reviews.author: Craig Jones

customer_reviews.title: A Grilling Buddie
customer_reviews.text: Works like magic. Remember no more than 3 crinkled newspapers.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Tostevin

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: delivers as advertised, a must have for charcoal grill users
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: NOTHING FANCY BUT WOW IT WORKS REALLY GREAT! FLAMES UP QUICKLY TO GET THE GRILL READY ...
customer_reviews.text: NOTHING FANCY BUT WOW IT WORKS REALLY GREAT! FLAMES UP QUICKLY TO GET THE GRILL READY FOR BBQ. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Polt

customer_reviews.title: Very good starter, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about these charcoal starters, I am so happy I bought this. I never noticed what a difference in charcoal temp this would make. Best of all, i no longer require lighter fluid. make sure to use newspaper, the ink allows good flammability. One thing I did notice, it does stain due to high heat. But still works great and saves you how much charcoal to use.
customer_reviews.author: New_Energy

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: Fits a ton of charcoal, saves me a ton of time and evenly heats the coals.
customer_reviews.author: Nic Childers

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! I can't believe I used to light coals any other way. This thing works like a charm and gets your coals ready to cook in no time!
customer_reviews.author: James W.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size saves charcoal.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this chimney because it is smaller than the other "famous" brand sold in the big box stores. I own both, and while the larger one is better quality, I can use this smaller one when I only need a few coals for a couple hamburgers or a steak or two (which is most of the time). This saves me a lot of money because charcoal is pretty expensive these days, and I hate to waste it. The other one is better for cookouts, where you need a lot of coals.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the shipment
customer_reviews.text: It arrived damaged but I needed it for that weekend that it arrived. Disappointed in the shipment.
customer_reviews.author: BEPW

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA, sad to say!  CAUTION!
customer_reviews.text: It came in one piece, undamaged, but has razor sharp edges on the top, bottom, heat shield and handle bracket that need deburring. Good thing I unpacked it carefully. It's pretty thin metal and probably won't last long, but will only be used as a backup when the electric starter fails. The price of $10 is good, and I won't return it. Sadly, it used to be the foreign made metal products that had sharp edges, and Americam Made was the sign of ultimate quality. I began ro debur it and cut my little finger without knowing it for a while! Be careful!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kitsko

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Well made, does the job, couldn't beat the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Wanetadrift

product_meta.title: GrillPro 39470 Chimney Charcoal Starter, Silver
product_meta.description: Style:Chimney StyleThe chimney-style charcoal starter lights charcoal without using starter fluid. It will hold up to 4-lbs of charcoal and your charcoal will be ready in 10 minutes when using this starting method.
feature_bullets: Charcoal Will Be Ready In 10 Minutes

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,030 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
